intro: Argythamnia sericea var. lanceolata, commonly known as the silky leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, silky hairs that help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its succulent leaves and ability to store water make it well adapted to drought conditions. This variant is distinguished by its lanceolate leaf shape, which sets it apart from other varieties within the Argythamnia genus.
